snippet: Federal officials have assessed more than 100 potential cases, but the only confirmed case is in Dallas, where the condition of the man with Ebola was changed to critical.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says it has assessed more than 100 possible Ebola cases, but only confirmed case is in Dallas, where condition of the man, Thomas E Duncan, has been changed from serious to critical.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and ROBERT PEAR
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Dallas, and Robert Pear from Washington. Abby Goodnough contributed reporting from Washington, and Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York.

lead_paragraph: Federal officials have assessed more than 100 potential cases, but the only confirmed case is in Dallas, where the condition of the man with Ebola was changed to critical.

headline.main: As U.S. Ebola Fears Widen, Reports of Possible Cases Grow
headline.print_headline: As U.S. Assesses Ebola, Possible Cases Increase

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
